data.enText: an agreement made between two people or groups in which each side gives up some of the things they want so that both sides are happy at the end

data.chText: 双方经过长期的商谈终于达成了妥协。
data.enText: After lengthy talks the two sides finally reached a compromise .

data.chText: 在任何关系当中，人们都得作出让步。
data.enText: In any relationship, you have to make compromises .

data.chText: 折中的解决方案 / 协议 / 候选人

data.enText: a solution to a problem in which two or more things cannot exist together as they are, in which each thing is reduced or changed slightly so that they can exist together

data.chText: 这种型号是价格和质量间的最佳折中方案。
data.enText: This model represents the best compromise between price and quality.
the act of reaching a compromise

data.chText: 妥协是生活不可避免的一部分。
data.enText: Compromise is an inevitable part of life.

data.chText: 目前还没有和解的希望。
data.enText: There is no prospect of compromise in sight.

data.chText: （为达成协议而）妥协，折中，让步
data.enText: to give up some of your demands after a disagreement with sb, in order to reach an agreement
Neither side is prepared to compromise.

data.chText: 经过激烈争论，评委终于同意那个18岁的钢琴手获奖。
data.enText: After much argument, the judges finally compromised on (= agreed to give the prize to) the 18-year old pianist.
They were unwilling to compromise with the military.
to do sth that is against your principles or does not reach standards that you have set

data.chText: 我拒绝在原则问题上妥协。
data.enText: I refuse to compromise my principles.

data.chText: 我们不愿在安全标准问题上放松。
data.enText: We are not prepared to compromise on safety standards.

data.chText: （尤指因行为不很明智）使陷入危险，使受到怀疑
data.enText: to bring sb/sth/yourself into danger or under suspicion, especially by acting in a way that is not very sensible

data.chText: 她接受了他的邀请，这件事已经使她的声誉受到了损害。
data.enText: She had already compromised herself by accepting his invitation.

data.chText: 在这个阶段的失败会减少他们进入决赛的机会。
data.enText: Defeat at this stage would compromise their chances (= reduce their chances) of reaching the finals of the competition.

word_means: 使陷入危险，使受到怀疑

means: (为达成协议而)妥协，折中，让步
(尤指因行为不很明智)使陷入危险，使受到怀疑

ex.chText: 双方达成妥协以解决他们之间的分歧。
ex.enText: Both sides reached a compromise to settle their differences.

ex.chText: 这两个邻国之间的政治和解已经取得进展。
ex.enText: Progress has been made towards a political compromise between the two neighboring countries.

ex.chText: 在现代婚姻中妥协是必不可少的。
ex.enText: Compromise is inevitable in modern marriage.

synonyms.bx: 指有关各方或人员均作出让步以达成的折中协议，也指妥协的行为。

ex.chText: 我们希望你们能在价格上作些让步。
ex.enText: We hope that you can make some concession on price.

ex.chText: 公司承诺给我们涨工资，这是公司对我们的要求作出的让步。
ex.enText: The company promised to increase our pay, which was its concession to our demands.

synonyms.bx: 指为结束争执、分歧等而对他方作出的退让。

ex.chText: 美满的婚姻在很大程度上取决于互敬互让。
ex.enText: A happy marriage depends largely on give-and-take.

ex.chText: 在任何人际关系中，都得互相忍让。
ex.enText: In any relationship, there has to be some give-and-take.

synonyms.bx: 指为满足彼此的意愿、要求等而互相作出的让步。

ex.en: compromise between someone and someone else
ex.zh: 某人与某人之间的妥协

tr: a middle way between two extremes
an accommodation in which both sides make concessions
example: the newly elected congressmen rejected a compromise because they considered it `business as usual'
nobody will get everything he want

tr: expose or make liable to danger, suspicion, or disrepute
example: The nuclear secrets of the state were compromised by the spy

value.def: A compromise is a situation in which people accept something slightly different from what they really want, because of circumstances or because they are considering the wishes of other people.

example.ex: Encourage your child to reach a compromise between what he wants and what you want...
example.tran: 鼓励孩子在他的愿望和你的愿望之间找到一个折中点。

example.ex: Be ready and willing to make compromises between your needs and those of your partner...
example.tran: 时刻准备好并乐意在自己与伴侣的需求之间作出让步。

example.ex: The government's policy of compromise is not universally popular.
example.tran: 政府的妥协政策并没有受到普遍欢迎。

value.def: If you compromise with someone, you reach an agreement with them in which you both give up something that you originally wanted. You can also say that two people or groups compromise .

example.ex: The government has compromised with its critics over monetary policies...
example.tran: 政府已经就货币政策向批评人士作出让步。

example.ex: 'Nine,' said I. 'Nine thirty,' tried he. We compromised on 9.15...
example.tran: “9点。”我说。“9点半。”他试着说。于是我们各让一步，定在了9点一刻。

example.ex: Israel had originally wanted $1 billion in aid, but compromised on the $650 million.
example.tran: 以色列原本想要获得10亿美元的援助，但后来作出让步，同意接受6.5亿的援助。

value.def: If someone compromises themselves or compromises their beliefs, they do something which damages their reputation for honesty, loyalty, or high moral principles.

example.ex: ...members of the government who have compromised themselves by co-operating with the emergency committee...
example.tran: 因与紧急委员会合作而使自己名誉受损的政府成员

example.ex: He would rather shoot himself than compromise his principles.
example.tran: 他宁愿一枪打死自己也不愿违背自己的原则。

value.tran: 使（自己）声誉受损;违背(信念)

tit: compromise between someone and someone else
trans: 某人与某人之间的妥协
